00100    // Clean the temp dir. Note that now where we have auto recovery the temp
00101    // dir is not cleaned at start up anymore. But it is cleaned when the
00102    // program is exited normally.
00103    static void CleanTempDir();
00104 
00105    // Check the project for errors and possibly prompt user
00106    //
00107    // forceerror: Always show log error dialog even if no errors are found
00108    //             Important when you know that there are already errors in
00109    //             the log
00110    //
00111    // silentlycorrect: Do not show an error dialog (except if forceerror is
00112    //             true) and silently correct problems the "safest" way.
00113    //             This leaves orphaned blockfiles on disk, but replaces
00114    //             files that are not found by silence
00115    //
00116    int ProjectFSCK(bool forceerror, bool silentlycorrect);
00117    
00118    // Remove all orphaned blockfiles without user interaction. This is
00119    // generally safe, because orphaned blockfiles are not referenced by the
00120    // project and thus worthless anyway.
00121    void RemoveOrphanedBlockfiles();

00124    // not interested in this information, but it is important for the
00125    // auto-save functionality

00128    // This should only be used by the auto save functionality

00130    
00131    // Do not delete any temporary files on exit. This is only called if
00132    // auto recovery is cancelled and should be retried later
00133    static void SetDontDeleteTempFiles() { dontDeleteTempFiles = true; }
